Subtitle: Git user configs
Intro: When you regularly do work on computers that other users use.

Cheats.Explanation: Unset user.name and user.email from git globally and locally. Unsets only for the windows user that runs this command and the local repo, where this is run. Does not unset global configs of other windows users in the machine.
Cheats.Cheat: git config --local --unset user.name && git config --local --unset user.email && git config --global --unset user.name && git config --global --unset user.email

Cheats.Explanation: Set your github user in your windows user globally. (Do not run in a local repo even with the --global tag.)
Cheats.Cheat: git config --global user.name 'MyGitHubUserName' && git config --global user.email 'my.email@address.com'

Cheats.Explanation: Edit commit author if you cannot set git config globally. This bypasses even the user config set in --local. Use this when you are not the only one with access to this machine.
Cheats.Cheat: git commit --author='Author Name <email@address.com>' -m '<Enter a commit message>'
